problem.markdown:
1. The alternating magnetic flues in a conductor caused by the current flowing in a neighbouring conductor gives rise to circulating currents which cause an apparent increases in the resistance of the conductor. This phenomena is called ________ .
() Skin effect () Corona effect (x) Proximity effect () None
2. The sag in aluminium conductors is __________ the copper conductors.
() Lesser than (x) Greater than () Equal to () 2 times lesser than
3. Copper conductor is
(x) All () It has high current density, so lesser X-sectional area of conductor is required () Homogenous material () Highly durable and has high scrap value
4. The skin effect is negligible when the supply frequency is ________ and the conductor diameter is _________.
() High, Large () High, Small (x) Low ,Small () Low ,Large
5. The factor which effect skin and proximity effects are ______________
() Size of the conductor and distance between the conductors () Frequency of the current (x) All () Permeability of the conductor material
problem.p: 1. The alternating magnetic flues in a conductor caused by the current flowing in a neighbouring conductor gives rise to circulating currents which cause an apparent increases in the resistance of the conductor. This phenomena is called ________ .
2. The sag in aluminium conductors is __________ the copper conductors.

choicegroup.choice: It has high current density, so lesser X-sectional area of conductor is required
Highly durable and has high scrap value

problem.p: 4. The skin effect is negligible when the supply frequency is ________ and the conductor diameter is _________.
5. The factor which effect skin and proximity effects are ______________

choicegroup.choice: Size of the conductor and distance between the conductors
